info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 30 at 2:56PM EDT until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of the western Piedmont of North Carolina and Upstate South Carolina, including the following areas, in the Piedmont of North Carolina, Cabarrus, Mecklenburg and Union NC. In upstate South Carolina, Chester, Greenwood, Laurens, Union SC and York. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - As Tropical Cyclone Idalia moves across southeast Georgia and the South Carolina coast, the northwest extent of the tropical rain will spread northward over the Upstate and Charlotte Metro region through this evening. Some locations mainly east of a line from Greenwood to Union in South Carolina to Charlotte in North Carolina may receive up to 2 inches of rain in a short period of time. Embedded torrential downpours within the rainbands could produce local one inch per hour, or greater, rainfall rates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means there is a potential for rapid onset flooding based on current forecasts. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation and may impact areas that do not typically flood. Please monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action quickly should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
